intro: Marlierea pilodes, commonly known as the hairy marlierea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
